remarks: Two ways of expressing substitution when ` y ` is not free in ` ph ` . The implication "to the left" is ~ equs4 and does not require the non-freeness hypothesis.  Theorem ~ sb56 replaces the non-freeness hypothesis with a dv condition.  (Contributed by NM, 25-Apr-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2016.)
statement:
equs45f.1 $e |- F/ y ph $.
equs45f $p |- ( E. x ( x = y /\ ph ) <-> A. x ( x = y -> ph ) ) $.
